meanings.definition: Separate into individual parts or components.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unbundled the colorful yarn to use for her knitting project.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to unbundled the engine to fix the issue.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to unbundled the tied ropes but ended up in a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to unbundled the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The children eagerly unbundled the gift wrap to reveal their new toys.

meanings.definition: Not packaged or sold as a single unit.
meanings.sent1: The unbundled snacks were perfect for sharing at the picnic.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to buy unbundled fruits to have a variety in her basket.
meanings.sent3: The unbundled puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The unbundled services allowed customers to choose only what they needed.
meanings.sent5: The unbundled cable channels gave viewers more control over their entertainment.
